description.narrative:
Syria is entering its 10th year of devastating conflict with the situation in the northern provinces worsening with a disrupted health system and a third of its facilities not fully functional. In addition, the COVID19 pandemic has further amplified the dire needs in the health sector while acting as a risk for the continuation of essential healthcare. Additionally, in the camps, COVID19 had increased the protection risk with 97% of the individuals in extreme poverty (SPRING 2021 REPORT SERIES - governate profiles).
The overall objective of this project is to support the continuation and scaling up the life-saving activities by complementing other existing grants and partnership. This will improve the access to health services for the most vulnerable population in Idleb. The specific objectives are : (1) Decrease the excess morbidity and mortality among trauma and orthopaedic cases in the district of Harim.
The proposed objectives require the support of one main infrastructure on the following activities: (1) supporting Alamal orthopaedic centre to continue providing lifesaving and life-sustaining healthcare. This includes the provision of orthopedic major surgeries, trauma management, diagnostic testing (laboratory and imagery), out-patient consultation, and referral from/to other health facilities in Harim district.
The proposal will reach about 37,000 direct beneficiaries and 300K indirect beneficiaries (mostly from the high priority areas) targeted by the intervention, for health services at least 40% out of direct beneficiaries will be women from the age of 18-50 and 12% will be people with disability. The project overall indirect beneficiaries are highly vulnerable communities. Based on the SCHF ranking, five of the communities served in this project are high-priority -Maaret Tamsrin, Dana, Qourqeena, Harim, Armanaz-, and two communities are a medium priority -Salqin.
COVID19 prevention measure: This project included the prevention measures in all of its activities to reduce the risk for the patients and hospital staff. Based on the COVID19 task force, the triage, referral of suspected cases, PPE and IPC implementation will be all applied. (see more in the risk management section)
